commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed Chat bot from Duke to Richie and implemented an initial skeletal version of the chatbot (ie. greeting the user and exit)
Allows chatbot to echo user commands and detects the "bye" command to exit
added ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user when required
Added a task class
Added the ability to mark tasks as done
Added support for tracking three types of tasks : ToDos, Deadlines, Events
Added in a set of inputs and the expected outputs (ie. added a test case)
Allowed the bot to handle errors or incorrect inputs by adding a InvalidInputException class and a few try catch blocks
Added support for deleting task from the list and also adding a try catch block for marking and deleting to handle errors
Add javadocs
Adds the ability to save the tasks in a text file whenever the task list changes.
Handle case where data file does not exist
Add data file and Richie Exception class
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Level-7:
  Handle case where data file does not exist
  Adds the ability to save the tasks in a text file whenever the task list changes.
  Add javadocs

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-CodingStandard'
Add javadocs for new public methods associated with the find functionality
Update build.gradle file
Add a GUI to the chat bot
Rename produced jar file produced to duke-1.jar from duke.jar
Abstract the conversion of a task to its data string to be stored in the data text file.
commitResults.messageBody:
Storage saveCurrentTask() method gets the task description and boolean about whether it is done and converts them into data string to be stored in data text file.

There are multiple levels of abstraction in the saveCurrentTask() method  making it difficult to read. There is also a lot of code duplication.

Creating a new abstract method toDataString() into the Task class ensures that all instances of classes that inherit from Task class will have its own adoption of a toDataString() method.

Let's create an abstract method in Task class called toDataString() and add the toDataString() method adaptation into all classes that inherit from Task, such as Deadline, Todo and Event.

Let's reduce the code duplication in the saveCurrentTask() method in the Storage class and remove the if else statements that differentiate the different types of tasks using instanceof operator.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve readability of all methods in the Parser class.
commitResults.messageBody:
1. convertInputDateAndTimeIntoLocalDateTime()

Year is represented by Integer.parseInt(dayMonthYearArray[2]) without any indication that it is equal to year. Same with month, day, hours and minutes.

convertInputDataAndTimeIntoLocalDateTime() method is difficult to read because of Integer.parseInt(dayMonthYearArray[i]). It is not clear what each element in dayMonthYearArray refers to immediately. Same with month, day, hours and minutes.

Make the code look simpler by assigning a variable year, month, day etc. to Integer.parseInt(dayMonthYearArray[i]).

2. Extra level of nesting due to  String[] stringArray = userInput.split(" ", 2); being out of each possible command else if section.

Leads to worse readability due to greater amount unnecessary nesting, moreover the line String[] stringArray = userInput.split(" ", 2); is not clear what it does.

Add a comment line above the line to explain what it does and also put it into the else if sections for commands that need to use the line so as to remove one layer of nesting.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve readability of Richie and TaskList methods.
commitResults.messageBody:
Confusing lines of code.

Confuses the reader what those lines of code mean and do

Add comments above lines of confusing code so as to help readers understand the flow better

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions in convertInputDateAndTimeIntoLocalDateTime() method in Parser class.
commitResults.messageBody:
User input day, month, year, hours and minutes are directly fed into the LocalDate.of() method.

The inputs go to the .of() method without being checked whether they are valid time inputs which might throw DateTimeException which gives a generic error message stating that there is a problem with the date time format in general.

Add assertions to check whether the time inputs are valid being passed into the .of() method.

This can give the user more specific error messages regarding their inputs which will be more useful to the user in correcting their user input.

commitResults.messageTitle: Increase flexibility of the find command.
commitResults.messageBody:
find command only returns tasks with descriptions that match the keyword exactly.

This is not flexible as user might want to find a range of tasks that share similar letters.

Prioritises the tasks with descriptions that match more letters of the keyword always starting from the keyword first letter. Loop through the keyword substrings until left with only the first letter of the keyword. If the task description contains the substring of the keyword, then add the task into the result. Use a HashMap to track which tasks have already been added and which have not been added to the result array. If the task description contains the keyword entirely it will definitely be shown in the result, but if the description only contains a substring that is a part of the keyword, then it might not be added to the result if the limit has been reached. The limit can be set in the FindCommand.

Gives the user more flexibility when searching for a task.
